div.div:
Benavides ISD Online Learning
Beginning March 30th Learn at Home

strong.font: Welcome to Benavides ISD - Home of the Mighty EAGLES

span.b: Benavides ISD will be closed starting March 23 - April 14, 2020.

a.title: Texas Assoc. of School Business Officials

li.a: Texas Assoc. of School Business Officials

span.h2: Governor Abbott has announced all Texas public schools will be closed for the reminder of the school year. Students are expected to complete assignments and grade will be taken. We’ve got this Eagles!

span.p: We love our Benavides ISD Senior Class 2020

span.h3: Seniors Apply for this Scholarship. Deadline April 20, 2020

h3.a: Agua Poquita Soil and Water Conservation District Scholarship

span.h3: Seniors are required to take an online CPR training as part of their graduation requirement.
Any senior who did not receive the scholarship information or the CPR information needs to email Ms. Cervantes at lcervantes@benavidesisd.net.

span.h2: Benavides Secondary was awarded the following:

a.title: Click to read more about: Employee Rights Regarding COVID-19

div.a: Read More about Employee Rights Regarding COVID-19

span.h3: Gov. Greg Abbott extends social distancing mandate and said Texas schools will remain closed through May 4.

div.a: Benavides ISD COVID-19 No Child Present Meal Pick Up Form

a.title: Click to read more about: Benavides ISD COVID-19 No Child Present Meal Pick Up Form

div.a: Read More about Benavides ISD COVID-19 No Child Present Meal Pick Up Form
Grab & Go Curbside Pickup Meals Food Safety Best Practices for Participants
Benavides ISD to provide free curbside meals to children 18 and younger.

span.p: During this difficult time of the coronavirus pandemic, parents and children are feeling stressed about COVID-19. Attached are helpful websites that offer coping tips for parents and children. COVID-19 prevention tips have also been included. Click on the links below for more information.
Resources for Supporting Children’s Emotional Well-Being…..
5 Social-Emotional Learning Tips for Families During the COVID-19
Supporting Families During COVID-19
Maintaining Emotional Health & Well-Being During the COVID-19 Outbreak
What To Do with Kids at Home on Coronavirus Break
Mental Health & Coping During COVID-19
COVID-19 Prevention Tips
Description
There’s currently no vaccine to prevent coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
You can protect yourself and help prevent spreading the virus to others if you:
Do
Wash your hands regularly for 20 seconds, with soap and water or alcohol-based hand rub
Cover your nose and mouth with a disposable tissue or flexed elbow when you cough or sneeze
Avoid close contact (1 meter or 3 feet) with people who are unwell
Stay home and self-isolate from others in the household if you feel unwell
Practice social distancing
Don't
Touch your eyes, nose, or mouth if your hands are not clean

span.p: Del Mar College Scholarship that is due on April 30th. Students can apply online for the above scholarship.
